= Introduction =

Here is some tips on how to import, edit and debug snofyre framework with Netbeans. 


= Pre-Requisites = 

In order to import edit and debug snofyre you require the following : 
Java jre 1.5 or higher and 
Netbeans 6.9.1 

This section assumes that you have already checked out Snofyre's source code using the instructions in the getting started page. Please read the instructions on this page, especially the note about test failures if you have not already done so.

=Getting Started=

Netbeans is able to open an existing maven based project without importing. Select Open Project, using File Menu --> Open Project, navigate to the location of the working copy of source. You should also be able to carry out svn based tasks (e.g. diff) from the editor.



= Debugging =

Once you have the project imported in to netbeans you can debug. 

In order to debug the app using NetBeans need to start the bundle in debug mode. From the command prompt in the install directory:

java -Xms250m -Xmx1000m -Xdebug -Xnoagent -Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,address=8888,server=y,suspend=y -jar org.eclipse.osgi-3.6.0v20100517.jar -console -configuration platform

Next add a break point in the relevant part of code. 

Next you need to attach the debugger open netbeans, select Debug--> Attach Debugger. 

In the dialog box Select JPDA Debugger  and Port 8888, leave other options as default.
